quotes.quote: Tyranny is the political corollary of socialism, as representative government is the political corollary of the market economy.
When enough people understand reality, tyrants can literally be ignored out of existence. They can't ever be voted out of existence.
All tyrannies rule through fraud and force, but once the fraud is exposed they must rely exclusively on force.
The tyranny of relativism is the spiritual poverty of our time.
Modern toleration is really a tyranny. It is a tyranny because it is a silence.
Tyranny is to compel men not to think as they do, to compel men to express thoughts that are not their own.
Every tyrant who has lived has believed in freedom for himself.
Tyranny, it must be remembered, does not arrive all at once it arrives in instalments, and it must be fought off in instalments.
The tyranny of a multitude is a multiplied tyranny.
Tyranny is abhorrent, freedom benefits all, whereas violence benefits no one for long.
The essence of tyranny is not iron law. It is capricious law.
Tyranny anywhere is a threat to freedom everywhere.
No tyrant need fear till men begin to feel confident in each other.
All tyranny needs to gain a foothold is for people of good conscience to remain silent.
If Tyranny and Oppression come to this land, it will be in the guise of fighting a foreign enemy.

There is no crueler tyranny than that which is perpetuated under the shield of law and in the name of justice.

Tyranny is the exercise of some power over a man, which is not warranted by law, or necessary for the public safety. A people can never be deprived of their liberties, while they retain in their own hands, a power sufficient to any other power in the state.
Tyrants are seldom free; the cares and the instruments of their tyranny enslave them.

Tyranny or slavery, born of selfishness, are the two educational methods of parents; all gradations of tyranny or slavery.
Tyranny is yielding to the lust of the governing.
Tyrants have always some slight shade of virtue; they support the laws before destroying them.

A tyrant is but like a king upon a stage, a man in a vizor, and acting the part of a king in a play: he is not really a king.
Tyranny is defined as that which is legal for the government but illegal for the citizenry.
Tyranny is like the electric wiring in an old house. A tyrant dies, the new tyrant takes possession, and all he has to do is drop the switch.
A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection.
There is no greater tyranny than that which is perpetrated under the shield of the law and in the name of justice.
Tyranny Absolves all faith; and who invades our rights, However his own commence, can never be But an usurper.
